title: Ramesses II
summary: Ramesses II (Ancient Egyptian: rꜥ-ms-sw, Rīʿaməsīsū, pronounced [ˈɾiːʕaʔ məˈsiːˌsuw]; c. 1303–1213 BC) was the third pharaoh of the Nineteenth Dynasty of Egypt. He is often regarded as the greatest, most celebrated, and most powerful pharaoh of the New Kingdom, itself the most powerful period of Ancient Egypt.[5]
